jobs.description:

experienced and expert teachers and professionals from IIT and IIM. The training module has
been designed with the aim to prepare students of classes VI to XII to tackle exams of various
boards, including CBSE, ICSE, Maharashtra, Karnataka, Jharkhand and Bihar and competitive
exams such as NTSE, Olympiads, KVPY, SAT, AP, Pre-AP.
Basicfirst supports students to –
- Build a strong academic foundation in various subjects
- Promote focused learning
- Enhance subject competency and knowledge
- Sharpen communication skills and aptitude
- Expose students to various exam scenarios
- Help meet academic goals
With methods such as contact programmes and periodic workshops, Basicfirst helps students progress from a basic level to an advanced level. With the aim to help
the students achieve maximum marks in their board exams, Basicfirst also encourages them to
excel in other competitive exams. Students of Basicfirst are equipped to participate in
competitive contests -such as Balshree and National Child awards.
There are only 60 seats in each center per class, which brings in better focus on students and
better performance. The courses support students to build a strong academic foundation in
various subjects, promote focused learning, enhance subject competency and knowledge,
sharpen communication skills and aptitude, expose students to various exam scenarios, and
help meet academic goals.
Basicfirst also enhances the mental skills of students in multiple disciples of their choice,
through workshops, to help students prepare for competitive exams, and seminars, which
brings in value based education, through which Indian values are also inculcated in the
students.

general.headline:
Turnaround Catalyst. 
Certified Organization Development & Change Practitioner, Executive Coach, Corporate Director
general.description:
Being a Turnaround Catalyst, I facilitate Personal, Organizational and Social Turnaround.

I am passionate about life, positivity and creating new possibilities; I embrace my profession with the same passion. I am one of those few who love what they do. 

In the 20+ years of my professional life, I wore many hats; of a Facilitator, Consultant, Advisor, Coach, Strategist, CEO and Entrepreneur. I’ve navigated numerous challenges and gained tremendous learning, unique multi-discipline understanding and ability, which is leveraged by my clients and me alike. 

As an OD and Change Management Consultant/Practitioner, I extend my understanding of behavioral science and frameworks of Change and OD to co-create uniquely organic solutions for the clients. I approach the interventions with an inquisitive inquirer’s mindset and an Action Researcher’s approach. 

As an Executive Coach for transformation and life skills, I work with Entrepreneurs & Leaders who are on a mission to create something remarkable through their organization or transforming their organization to something more remarkable than it already is. I make myself available to my coaching clients as a firm, non-judgmental, turnaround catalyst & support system empowering them to create wonders & take on the challenges head on. My clients often express that they find my knack of asking such questions which broadens their perspectives, very empowering and supportive. While, I find this as "living my life’s purpose"​ of empowering others; it is abundantly fulfilling for me. 

I head a consulting company, Auralis Consulting offering consulting in Organization Development, Change & Transformation, Coaching and Mentoring, tailored L&D and Training solutions. 

When I’m not on one of the left brained adventures, I am busy recharging my right brain. I enjoy the company of both, left and right brain dominated people. Do reach out to me if you would like to know how I can be of benefit to your professional adventures.

general.description:
Goals: Looking for a career in Software Development

Name of assignment or project: MULTIMEDIA SANITY AND FEATURE TESTING 
Duration: January 2009 – Till Date
Team size: 6
Position held: Test Engineer (Manual and Automation)
           
The Multimedia feature testing project involves testing of various multimedia features like playback and capture of audio, video and pictures, testing various audio-video codecs and image formats, fast scrolling of different menu items on phone, testing of various accessories like Bluetooth and normal headsets etc.  

Roles assumed:  
          
Scripting the test cases using WEB CRAWLER SCRIPTING LANGUAGE (specific to Motorola)
 
Running the existing scripts and reporting any discrepancies or defects

Verifying the test suites to find out test cases that can be automated

Explore the phone rigorously to find hidden flaws 

Report existing flaws and making sure that the defects are solved properly

Suggesting and implementing new ways of making the process more extensive and optimal

Name of assignment or project: VIDEO TELEPHONY AND  RICH VOICE CALL 
Duration: November 2008 – Till Date
Team size: 2
Position held: Test Engineer

This project involved testing of various multimedia communication features like Rich Voice Call (RVC) and Video telephony. Rich Voice Call (RVC) is a feature that supports live video transport over IP network while on a CS voice call. Video telephony is different from RVC as it uses a packet switched network for both voice and video transmission. Testing of these two features in India involved 3G base station simulators like Anritsu and JRC (Japan Radio Company). 

Roles Assumed:

Execute the test cases and report the defects found

Establish the USB set up required for RVC testing

To monitor the flow of packets during RVC to get a feel of the inherent protocols

Training the Sanity team on the USB set up process with a demonstration

Specialties: C, C++, TCL/TK., PERL, LINUX, COMPUTER NETWORKS, IMAGE PROCESSING, COMPUTER VISION, COMPUTER GRAPHICS

jobs.description:
Multi-Resolution Tracking in Space and Time 
 
This project proposes efficient and robust methods for tracking a moving object at multiple spatial and  temporal resolution levels. The efficiency comes from optimizing the amounts of spatial and temporal data processed. The robustness results from multi-level coarse-to-fine state-space searching. Tracking across resolution levels incurs an accuracy-versus-speed trade-off with higher resolutions maintaining a higher accuracy at the cost of greater processing cost and time and lower resolutions reducing both the processing time and accuracy. We propose a novel spatial multi-scale tracker that tracks at the optimal accuracy-versus-speed operating point. Next, we relax this requirement to propose a multi-resolution tracker that operates at a minimum acceptable performance level. Finally, we extend these ideas to a multi-resolution spatio-temporal tracker

general.description:
Deepak Goel is the Founder & CEO of KarmaCircles. Prior to that, he was co-founder and Chief Technology Officer of Packback (a Chicago-based startup funded by Mark Cuban & other notable angel investors) where he built their product strategy, online marketing strategy and engineering team. Prior to that, he was the Chief Product Officer of IndiaHomes (backed by NEA, Foundation Capital & Helion Ventures) where he built & led product management, marketing and engineering teams. Before that, he was Director of Product Management at Coupons.com (NYSE:QUOT, now called Quotient Technology Inc.) where he created & grew several multi-million dollar products. He has also been a senior executive at Microsoft & Nokia.

Deepak is a serial entrepreneur and has been with three startups across stages (0-1 million, 1-10 million and 10-100 million). He has experience across domains (email, content, coupons, retail, e-commerce, real estate, maps, traffic & education), across product types (consumer, enterprise, mobile, social and platform), across functions (engineering, product management & marketing) and across levels (individual contributor, manager, director, VP and CXO).

Deepak is a mentor at 500 Startups and an angel investor in few startups (Sverve, Packback, Wishberry, Stylisted). He is also an advisor to Khosla Impact Fund & Impact Engine accelerator and advises several companies on strategy, product, marketing and technology.

Over the last few years, Deepak has reviewed thousands of business plans and has advised more than a thousand entrepreneurs in various areas. He has also judged several business plan competitions in University of Chicago, Booth School of Business and Haas School of Business at UC Berkeley.

Deepak holds an MBA from Haas School of Business, UC Berkeley and is also a graduate from IIT, Delhi, India. He is a TEDx speaker, Mensa member and has been issued 4 patents for his inventions.

general.description:
I am over 38 years experienced in windmill ( & SPM)manufacturing , O & M Engineering (mech.), Technology Transfer, Product Development and facilitating the Certification process. I also have extensive experience in establishing manufacturing and service set ups for heavy machineries.
In Octber 18, I have taken retirement from my job with InoxWind as V.P. Operations (Nacelle manufacturing) and looking for a further assignment in the areas of:
Engineering (mech.) and product development,
Technology Evaluation and Transfer,
Product Evaluation,
Quality Assurance and Certification etc.

Some of my Achievements:

In Inox Wind Ltd, I had established manufacturing and Quality operations for Nacelle, Blade & Tower Plants, carried out Due-Diligence of turbine design through GL-Garrad  Hassan; done technology transfer for manufacturing of Blade, Nacelle and Tower from Windtech (AMSC) and kicked start series productions; had taken key role in product certification and future model developments.

In Suzlon Energy Ltd, as a founder team member, I had taken various lead roles in the technology transfer ,product evaluation and engineering for initial entry model (350KW) and up to the first  export model S88 (2MW). 
Established first formal O&M operation in the year 1999.Also established and led O&M Engineering (mech.) team from the year 2000 to 2004.
I had also led two years long various major retrofitting activities at sites in Portugal, USA and Brazil.

 In Kolsite Maschine Fabrik Ltd., I was in a leading role to develop and engineer two plastic   processing lines first time in India, namely, ‘Oscillating nip 3 layer extrusion lineand Woven sack recycling line. 
     
In Indian Chain Pvt. Ltd., I had developed “Vertical bar reeling machine” for Indian Rail way and “120 Ton Horizontal tensile testing Machine “for Bangladesh Rail way.

jobs.description: Retired and available

Since Dec.2010  I am with INOX WIND LTD (www.inoxwind.com) as Head of Wind Turbine manufacturing  operations in the unit situated in Himachal.

Reporting to : Promoter Director & CEO.

This unit is consisting of Assembly (production), Material Management, Quality Assurance, HR, Accounts, Purchase, PPC and Process Engineering departments. It also has a small workshop for development of jigs and fixtures.
This unit is equipped with heavy duty cranes, mobile material handling equipment, hydraulic and pneumatic heavy duty tools and other equipment. 
In the year 2016-2017 this unit had produced 264 numbers of 2MW Wind Turbines (528MW) worth about INR 15 billion.

Nov.1998 to Nov.2010, I was with SUZLON ENERGY LTD (www.suzlon.com) as Head of Turbine manufacturing units situated in Daman (UT).

Was Reporting to: CMD & CMO.

I joined this company during its start up period as Manager Works, to establish the first Wind Turbine manufacturing unit in Diu (UT).With time rose to the position of General Manager and was made responsible for three manufacturing units in Daman (UT), including one EOU.
In between during 2007-2008, I had shouldered additional overseas operation responsibilities  to the best satisfaction of  management.
I was proud receiver of a distinctive honor, PLATINUM Award Certificate for extraordinary performance.

From February 1995 to November 1998, I was working with KOLSITE MASCHIINE FABRIK LTD (www.kolsite.com) as Head of Machine Production, Development, Trial & Testing in Daman unit.
Was Reporting to: V.P. Works & Director.

I joined as “Manager- Development, Trial &Testing” in Daman unit, entrusted afterword with the additional responsibility of Production Manager.
Worked as an extended arm of corporate Engineering Division, along with productivity and product quality improvement, I was also responsible for continuous product development and technology transfer. 
During this period, I had established four new production lines, namely, oscillating nip 3 layer plant, High speed tape plant, 50mm three layer plant and high speed mono filament plant.
I was proud receiver of distinctive award for manufacturing of Oscillating nip 3 layers Extrusion Plant - first of its kind in India- as Team Leader.

Reporting to: CEO	 

I was responsible for Mould design office, Machine Shop, Quality Assurance, Foundry and Mould repairing shop. My designation was Deputy Manager Engineering.

      Mumbai, as a Service Engineer for CNC Machines, stationed at Jamshedpur.

From January 1982 to February 1992, I was working with INDIAN CHAIN PVT. LTD. Calcutta, (www.indianchain.com) as the Head of SPM Manufacturing Division. 

Reporting to: Promoter Director & G.M. Works.
 
 I Joined here as Trainee Engineer and rose to the position of Sr.Design Engineer in seven years. My role was to run a small scale machine manufacturing unit. I made SPMs like ‘Center less bar turning machine’, ‘Bar straightening machine’, ‘Billet grinding machine’, ‘Horizontal and vertical tensile testing machines’ supplied mainly to various rail way factories in India and Bangladesh. 
I got hands on experience in Machine Assembly, Pneumatic & Hydraulic Systems and Automation, Heavy Fabrication, Q.A, Machine Shop and other related activities.
Before parting off, I was driving a project for developing ‘Center less Uranium bar Turning Machine’   for Bhaba Atomic Research Center, Trombay, and also engineered an ‘Automatic flash trimming machine’ for captive use in Chain Division. The later one saved import cost of about INR10 million.
